intro: Alkanna auranitica, commonly known as the golden alkanna, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy, branched stems and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Alkanna auranitica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant color and unique morphology.
